intro: Cyrtandra arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfaken Island heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often near streams or in rocky areas. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and somewhat woody. Cyrtandra arfakensis is considered a rare and endemic species, highlighting its ecological significance to the unique flora of Hawaii.
